prompts.title: Gratitude in Small Moments
prompts.description: Reflect on three small wins from today
prompts.prompt_text: List three small moments from today that you're grateful for. They don't need to be big—a good cup of coffee, a kind word, or a moment of peace all count.
follow_up_questions: Which of these moments surprised you?
How can you create more moments like these tomorrow?
Who contributed to these moments, and have you thanked them?

stoic_wisdom.quote: He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.
stoic_wisdom.author: Epictetus
stoic_wisdom.translation: Focus on what you have, not what you're missing.

prompts.title: Control vs. Concern
prompts.prompt_text: Write about something that's bothering you. Draw two columns: one for what you can control about it, one for what you can't. Where should you focus your energy?
follow_up_questions: What's one action you can take today on what you can control?
Can you let go of what you can't control?
How does this shift in focus feel?

stoic_wisdom.quote: The chief task in life is simply this: to identify and separate matters so that I can say clearly to myself which are externals not under my control, and which have to do with the choices I actually control.
stoic_wisdom.author: Epictetus
stoic_wisdom.translation: Focus only on what you can actually control—let go of everything else.

prompts.title: Daily Wins Review
prompts.prompt_text: What are three things you accomplished today? They can be big or small—finishing a task, showing up for someone, or just getting through a tough day.
follow_up_questions: Which accomplishment are you most proud of?
What made these wins possible?
How can you build on this momentum tomorrow?

prompts.title: Energy Inventory
prompts.prompt_text: List the people, activities, and thoughts that gave you energy today. Then list what drained your energy. What patterns do you notice?
follow_up_questions: Can you reduce or eliminate any energy drains?
How can you create more space for energy sources?
What's one boundary you need to set?

prompts.title: Future Self Check-In
prompts.prompt_text: Think about the version of yourself one year from now. What would future you thank you for doing (or not doing) today?
follow_up_questions: What small action can you take today that future you will appreciate?
What habit is future you grateful you started or stopped?
Are your daily choices aligned with who you want to become?

stoic_wisdom.quote: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
stoic_wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius
stoic_wisdom.translation: Think big picture—your daily choices shape your entire life.

prompts.title: Difficult Conversation Prep
prompts.prompt_text: Is there a conversation you've been avoiding? Write about why it's difficult, what you hope to achieve, and how you want to show up in that conversation.
follow_up_questions: What's the worst that could happen if you have this conversation?
What's the cost of continuing to avoid it?
How can you approach this with respect and clarity?

prompts.title: Spending Reflection
prompts.prompt_text: Review your spending this week. Which purchases aligned with your values? Which didn't? No judgment—just awareness.
follow_up_questions: What motivated your best financial decision this week?
What triggered any regrettable purchases?
What's one spending habit you want to change?

prompts.title: Emotional Weather Report
prompts.prompt_text: Describe your emotional state today as if it were weather. Are you sunny and clear? Cloudy with chance of rain? A thunderstorm passing through? What caused this weather?
follow_up_questions: Is this weather temporary or has it been around for a while?
What do you need when you're in this emotional weather?
Can you accept this weather without trying to force it to change?

prompts.title: Values Check-In
prompts.prompt_text: Name your top three values (e.g., honesty, growth, connection). How did your actions today reflect these values? Where did you drift?
follow_up_questions: When you acted in alignment with your values, how did it feel?
What pulled you away from your values today?
What's one way to live more aligned tomorrow?

stoic_wisdom.quote: If it is not right, do not do it. If it is not true, do not say it.
stoic_wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius

prompts.title: Obstacle as Opportunity
prompts.prompt_text: What obstacle or challenge did you face today? Write about how this obstacle might actually be helping you grow stronger, wiser, or more resilient.
follow_up_questions: What skill is this challenge forcing you to develop?
Will this matter in a year? Five years?
How would a stronger version of you handle this?

stoic_wisdom.quote: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
stoic_wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius
stoic_wisdom.translation: Every obstacle is a chance to get better.

prompts.title: Kindness Audit
prompts.prompt_text: Write about a moment today when someone showed you kindness, or when you showed kindness to someone else (including yourself).
follow_up_questions: How did this act of kindness impact you or them?
Who in your life could use more kindness from you?
How can you be kinder to yourself tomorrow?

prompts.title: Judgment Detox
prompts.prompt_text: Who or what did you judge today (including yourself)? Write about that judgment without defending it. Just observe it. Where did it come from?
follow_up_questions: What would happen if you released this judgment?
Is this judgment protecting you from something?
Can you replace judgment with curiosity?

stoic_wisdom.quote: When you wake up in the morning, tell yourself: The people I deal with today will be meddling, ungrateful, arrogant, dishonest, jealous, and surly. But I have seen the beauty of good, and the ugliness of evil.
stoic_wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius
stoic_wisdom.translation: Expect others to be flawed—and practice understanding anyway.

prompts.title: Progress Over Perfection
prompts.prompt_text: Where did you expect perfection from yourself today? Write about one area where you made progress, even if it wasn't perfect.
follow_up_questions: What's the difference between striving and suffering?
If you treated yourself like a good friend, what would you say?
What's one thing you can celebrate about today's effort?

prompts.title: Mortality Meditation
prompts.prompt_text: If today were your last day, what would you regret not doing? Not saying? Not experiencing? This isn't morbid—it's clarity.
follow_up_questions: What's stopping you from doing these things now?
How would you live differently if you truly believed your time was limited?
What matters most when you think about the end?

stoic_wisdom.quote: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.
stoic_wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius
stoic_wisdom.translation: Live like your time is limited—because it is.

prompts.title: Boundary Setting
prompts.prompt_text: Where did you feel your boundaries were crossed today? Or where did you need to set a boundary but didn't? Write about what happened and what you need.
follow_up_questions: What's the cost of not setting this boundary?
What are you afraid will happen if you set it?
How can you communicate this boundary clearly and kindly?

prompts.title: Money Mindset Check
prompts.prompt_text: Finish this sentence: 'Money is...' Write whatever comes to mind. Then explore where that belief came from and whether it's serving you.
follow_up_questions: What did your family teach you about money?
How does your current money mindset affect your decisions?
What healthier belief about money would you like to adopt?

prompts.title: Evening Wind-Down
prompts.prompt_text: As you end your day, write about: one thing that went well, one thing that was hard, and one thing you learned.
follow_up_questions: What are you grateful for from today?
What do you want to release before sleep?
What intention do you want to set for tomorrow?

prompts.title: Comparison Trap
prompts.prompt_text: Who did you compare yourself to today? Write about how that comparison made you feel and what it revealed about what you value or want.
follow_up_questions: What would change if you stopped comparing?
Are you comparing your behind-the-scenes to someone's highlight reel?
What's one unique strength you have that no comparison can take away?

stoic_wisdom.quote: How much more harmful are the consequences of anger and grief than the circumstances that aroused them in us!
stoic_wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius
stoic_wisdom.translation: Your reaction hurts you more than the thing you're reacting to.

prompts.title: Presence Practice
prompts.description: Notice when you were fully present
prompts.prompt_text: Describe one moment today when you were fully present—not thinking about the past or future, just here. What did you notice?
follow_up_questions: How did being present feel different than being distracted?
What pulls you away from the present moment most often?
How can you create more present moments tomorrow?

prompts.title: Virtue in Action
prompts.prompt_text: Choose one Stoic virtue (wisdom, courage, justice, or temperance). How did you practice it today? Where could you have practiced it better?
follow_up_questions: What made it easy or hard to practice this virtue today?
Who do you know who embodies this virtue?
How can you practice this virtue more tomorrow?

stoic_wisdom.quote: Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.
stoic_wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius
stoic_wisdom.translation: Stop thinking about virtue—start practicing it.
